TopicTitle: need help finding good mods for a project

Articles.Content: Hey, currently at the early stages of building a replica of the ISS.  However, I have been struggling to find mods to allow me to build the Zarya ISS Module.  Could use some help to point me in the right direction.  I know the ISS Community is, at this point, defunct, so I have chosen to ignore it fully, in favor of just building my own.  preferably would like for the parts to be compatible with tweakscale, as I will be using a mix of parts from various packs, if I have to.

Maybe check out Raiz Space on Youtube? 

He's building the ISS in RO, check  out which mods he is using. 

Edited June 12, 2020 by Kartoffelkuchen
I'm not sure if any of the Tantares packs may have Zarya modules & stuff, but you might want to check them out. Also, for ISS stuff, have you checked out CXG's CXAerospace, or benjee's HabTech mods?

21 hours ago, Sampa said:

 I know the ISS Community is, at this point, defunct, so I have chosen to ignore it fully, in favor of just building my own.  preferably would like for the parts to be compatible with tweakscale, as I will be using a mix of parts from various packs, if I have to.

Hi. I have kicked out TweakScale Companion Program exactly for these situations.

Post a request on that thread, linking me to where to fetch the Add'Ons you are interested on have support, and I (or someone else, if I find a volunteer) will tackle it down as time allows.

You want this: https://github.com/friznit/Unofficial-Tantares-Wiki/blob/master/ISS.craft

Tantares and habtech2 as far as I remember. Tantares has the Mir module, Zarya is basically a refurbished Mir module. Also look for Tantares now in colors devbuild, has some nice color options matching the Zarya.

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/73686-19x-tantares-stockalike-soyuz-and-mir-21215052020feature-complete/&do=findComment&comment=3771153

https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/168885-19x-tantares-and-bdb-now-in-colors/

SSTU also has russian modules: 

 

Edited June 13, 2020 by hendrack
